update.description:
Redo of pull request #2107, which was broken into:

* pull request #2220 (merged)
* pull request #2263 (merged)
* pull request #2309 (merged)
* this PR

This pull request makes it possible to open a world  without restarting the server. The client is not working yet, so a way to test this would be:

1. Build the example publishers added in this PR

2. Start gzserver with a world of your choosing

3. Publish either a new world or open world message using the standalone publishers:
    * ./pub_new_world
    * ./pub_open_world <full path>

4. Now open gzclient and check that the new world has been opened and there are no traces of the old world.

[trusty gpu](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/414/) ok

[ABI](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/1/API_ABI_report/) not broken
update.title: A whole new world all over again (server side)

content.raw:
Yup, we need more tutorials on development. 

Ideally though, the lifetime of our pointers would be managed in such a way that calling `Fini` is not necessary, this is more like a hack. But... a necessary one to decrease memory leaks for now...
content.html:
Yup, we need more tutorials on development.

Ideally though, the lifetime of our pointers would be managed in such a way that calling Fini is not necessary, this is more like a hack. But... a necessary one to decrease memory leaks for now...

pullrequest.title: A whole new world all over again (server side)

content.raw: hmmm maybe we should add that to our tutorials. AFAIK None of them suggest this, and I've certainly never done it for any of my plugins.
content.html: hmmm maybe we should add that to our tutorials. AFAIK None of them suggest this, and I've certainly never done it for any of my plugins.

pull_request.title: A whole new world all over again (server side)

pullrequest.title: A whole new world all over again (server side)

content.raw:
All plugins should clean up the pointers they're holding. The most important call here is `node->Fini()`, the node won't be properly terminated without that. 

This PR fixes the plugins which are present in example worlds, but we should make sure all plugins are properly cleaned up (and it would be great to have example worlds for all of them too).
content.html:
All plugins should clean up the pointers they're holding. The most important call here is node->Fini(), the node won't be properly terminated without that.

This PR fixes the plugins which are present in example worlds, but we should make sure all plugins are properly cleaned up (and it would be great to have example worlds for all of them too).

content.raw: So, does this change mean all plugins need to do something like this now? Or is it just some of them
content.html: So, does this change mean all plugins need to do something like this now? Or is it just some of them

pullrequest.title: A whole new world all over again (server side)

content.raw: The PR2 problem seems to be related to the `RaySensor`. In fact, on this branch, if you insert a hokuyo and then delete it, gzserver crashes. Still looking into it.
content.html: The PR2 problem seems to be related to the RaySensor. In fact, on this branch, if you insert a hokuyo and then delete it, gzserver crashes. Still looking into it.

pull_request.title: A whole new world all over again (server side)

pullrequest.title: A whole new world all over again (server side)

content.raw:
Ok, I addressed those. Removed the sleeps of many seconds and substituted by checks to see if things are actually clean.

I also manually opened every world which ships with Gazebo. They all seem to be cleaned up and open properly except for those which have the PR2, which actually crash Gazebo when trying to open from a message (they still open normally from startup though). I'll look into this later.

`INTEGRATION_world_open` passes properly except for `OpenWorldMsg`, which has a left over `/gazebo/default/request` topic, I still don't know where that's coming from.
content.html:
Ok, I addressed those. Removed the sleeps of many seconds and substituted by checks to see if things are actually clean.

I also manually opened every world which ships with Gazebo. They all seem to be cleaned up and open properly except for those which have the PR2, which actually crash Gazebo when trying to open from a message (they still open normally from startup though). I'll look into this later.

INTEGRATION_world_open passes properly except for OpenWorldMsg, which has a left over /gazebo/default/request topic, I still don't know where that's coming from.

pull_request.title: A whole new world all over again (server side)
